document.docAuthor: Cazorla, Carla G. & Spinelli, Gustavo R.
document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the Patagonian predaceous midges of the subgenus Acanthohelea of Stilobezzia excluding the S. (A.) edwardsi group (Diptera: Ceratopogonidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the Patagonian predaceous midges of the subgenus Acanthohelea of Stilobezzia excluding the S. (A.) edwardsi group (Diptera: Ceratopogonidae)

bibRefCitation.author: Cazorla CG & Spinelli GR
bibRefCitation.refString: Cazorla CG, Spinelli GR. 2007. A new species of Patagonian Stilobezzia (Acanthohelea) and a redescription of S. (A.). nigerrima Ingram & Macfie (Diptera: Ceratopogonidae). Trans Am Entomol Soc. 133: 181 - 187. doi: 10.3157 / 0002 - 8320 (2007) 133 [181: ANSOPS] 2.0. CO; 2

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Stilobezzia ( Acanthohelea ) curvistyla Cazorla and Spinelli, 2007: 182
(male, female, Argentina );
Borkent, 2014: 134
(in online World catalogue).

subSubSection.paragraph:
The only Patagonian species of
Stilobezzia ( Acanthohelea )
in which the gonostylus is abruptly curved. Females scutellum with 6 large and 5 thinner setae, sternite 8 with lateral margins rounded and U-shaped posteromedian excavation.

Argentina ( Neuquen, Río Negro, Chubut ), Chile (Valdivia, Llanquihue, Osorno) ( Figure 16 )
.

materialsCitation.collectorName: G. Spinelli & Other & San Martin & Andes & M. Gentili & Gutierrez & J. Liotta

23 April 1982
, M. Gentili , 1 female , light trap ; Río Negro prov. , lago Gutiérrez ,
January 2003
